content.rendered:
What is a Medical Scientist?

Medical Scientists research and conduct experiments that aim to discover new information in the field of medicine. These experiments often address finding cures for diseases, understanding complicated medical phenomena, and learning more about the physical human experience.

Where does a Medical Scientist work?

  • Laboratories
  • Offices
  • Hospitals

How much does a Medical Scientist make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Medical Scientist is $41,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Medical Scientists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Biology 
  • Chemistry majors
  • Math majors
Search Medical Scientist jobs on Handshake

Medical Scientist skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Medical Scientists succeed in their work:

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of data analysis
  • Good observation skills

What are some common questions about Medical Scientists?

Q: Are Medical Scientists in demand?A: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, employment for Medical Scientists is projected to grow 6% from 2019 to 2029.
